description: path to image displayed in central arrow location for given trial
detail: path to image displayed in central arrow location for given trial

description: path to image displayed in inner rigth arrow location for given trial
detail: path to image displayed in inner rigth arrow location for given trial

description: path to image displayed in outer right arrow location for given trial
detail: path to image displayed in outer right arrow location for given trial

description: path to image displayed in inner left arrow location for given trial
detail: path to image displayed in inner left arrow location for given trial

description: path to image displayed in outer left arrow location for given trial
detail: path to image displayed in outer left arrow location for given trial

description: stimulus array shown on given trial
detail: stimulus array shown on given trial
valueInfo: 1, practice trial right target congruent | 2, practice trial left target congruent | 3, practice trial right target incongruent | 4, practice trial left target incongruent | 41, nonsocial trial right target congruent | 42, nonsocial trial left target congruent | 43, nonsocial trial right target incongruent | 44, nonsocial trial left target incongruent | 51, social trial right target congruent | 52, social trial left target congruent | 53, social trial right target incongruent | 54, social trial left target incongruent |

description: congruency of stimulus array on given trial
detail: congruency of stimulus array on given trial

description: target direction
detail: direction of central stimulus

description: social or nonsocial condition
detail: text displayed to participant, which denotes if in social or nonsocial condition

description: block number for practice
detail: block number, starting at 0 for first block of practice

description: trial number of current practice block
detail: trial number of current practice block, starting at 0 for first trial of current practice block. Restarts at 0 for each additional practice block

description: social or nonsocial condition
detail: binary number denoting what condition (social or nonsocial)

description: block number for this condition
detail: block number, starting at 0 for first block of current condition (social or nonsocial)

description: trial number of current condition block
detail: trial number of current condition block, starting at 0 for first trial of current condition block. Restarts at 0 for each additional block in this condition

description: inter stimulus interval
detail: inter stimulus interval (ISI) in seconds. Denotes time between offset of stimulus from prior trial and onset of next trial stimulus

description: vector of response values for current trial of practice
detail: vector of response values corresponding to all responses made during the response window on the current trial of practice
valueInfo: corresponds to buttonbox button or keyboard key

description: accuracy of first response provided on trial
detail: accuracy of first response provided on a trial. Same variable used for practice and main task

description: vector of rt values for current trial of practice
detail: vector of rts corresponding to all responses made during the response window on the current trial of practice

description: vector of response values for current trial of main task
detail: vector of response values corresponding to all responses made during the response window on the current trial of main task
valueInfo: corresponds to buttonbox button or keyboard key

description: vector of rt values for current trial of main task
detail: vector of rts corresponding to all responses made during the response window on the current trial of main task

description: feedback code for last block
detail: code denoting which type of feedback was presented. The feeback is provided at the end of a block, about the block just completed, prior to starting the next block. If accuracy is greater than or equal to 75% but less than 90%, feedback will be "Good Job". If accuracy is greater than or equal to 90%, feedback will be "Respond faster". If accuracy is less than 75%, feedback will be "Respond more accurately".

description: participant id
detail: participant id that is manually entered at start of task

description: counterbalance code
detail: participant counterbalance that is manually entered at start of task

description: session code
detail: participant session that is manually entered at start of task

description: run code
detail: participant run that is manually entered at start of task

description: date of data collection
detail: date when task was run. auto-populated when task run

description: psychopy version for data collection
detail: psychopy version used to run experiment. auto-populated when task run

description: frame rate for data collection
detail: framerate used to run experiment. auto-populated when task run
